title: Voltskiya

sections.title: Learning
sections.description: Developed Minecraft plugins to create a unique experience in a survival server.
summary: Made very basic plugins such as preventing mobs from equiping armor on the ground or slowing players natural health regeneration
comments: I started learning how to use Github at this time

Git-Initial.comment: The first repository. Meant to encompass all features

sections.title: Expansion
sections.description: Immensely expanded the code base by adding mob abilities, game mechanics, and a mob system.
summary: Added an extensive library of mob abilities so a 'GameMaster' (a person) could mix and match abilities to create new mobs. This also included 'leaps' so certain mobs could jump higher and at various speeds on a cooldown
Added a series of game features such as Temperature, Thirst, Stamina, and skill points
Created MobSystem_v1 by pre-scanning the world to find spawnable places according to a series of spawning rules
comments: Was learning SQL at this time. I think it was good experience to not use an ORM to learn how to write the queries

Git-GameMechanics.comment: Repo for all major game mechanics

Git-CustomMobs.comment: Repo for all added custom mobs

Git-Utilities.comment: Repo for common utilities specific to Voltskiya

Git-Decay.comment: Decay and regeneration of the map was big enough to be it's own repo

comments: I really grew as a programmer with this project more than any other to date.
Working to develop for an ever-changing environment taught me the importance of writing code that didn't just get the job done for today, but also for the next project
